docs.snippet: The scenes peculiar to San Francisco during the prevalence of the Vigilance-Committee excitement there, are now being enacted in New-Orleans. A revolution is in progress there. The long series of outrages which have, of late, disdisgraced that city...
docs.lead_paragraph: The scenes peculiar to San Francisco during the prevalence of the Vigilance-Committee excitement there, are now being enacted in New-Orleans. A revolution is in progress there. The long series of outrages which have, of late, disdisgraced that city have at length driven the citizens to the desperate remedy of taking the law into their own hands.

headline.main: SWILL-MILK INVESTIGATION.; Testimony of Dr. Francis, Dr. Griscom, James Aitchison, Aaron C. Underhill, and Norman Van Nostrand. LONG TAILS VERSUS NO TAILS. Origin and Progress of the "Cow Distemper." Effects of Swill Upon Cows and of Swill-Milk Upon Children.

docs.abstract: Discussions in the Academy of Medicine
docs.lead_paragraph: There was a meeting of the Swill-milk Committee of the Board of Health,in Room No. 8 City Hall yesterday afternoon. The time set down for meeting was 2 o'clock; and at that hour the main room of the Clerk of the Common Council was nearly filled with men strongly impressed in favor of the milk crawn from the stump tailed animals that abound in the various swill-stables in this City and in Brooklyn.

headline.main: THREE DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE.; Arrival of the America at Halifax and the North Star at this Port. THE MINISTERIAL CRISIS IN ENGLAND. Escape of the Derby Government from a Vote of Censure. A Storm between England and Naples. Preparations to Lay the Atlantic Cable. THE CENTRAL AMERICAN IMBROGLIO. Views of the Madrid Press on a Protectorate Over Mexicao. Cotton Declined--Consols 97 3-4.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Royal Mail Steamship America, Captain MILLAR, which sailed from Liverpool at 3 o'clock on the afternoon of May 22, arrived at Halifax at 5 o'clock yesterday morning. The America, May 22, passed steamship Arabia from New-York for Liverpool. The North Star, from Southampton on the 19th ult., arrived at this port yesterday.

headline.main: Have we a District-Atttorney?-Have we a Surrogate ?

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Times: At the Judicial election in this City last Fall, the Democrats elected their whole ticket by a sweeping majority of over 15,000 votes. Many of the judges thus elected are of the highest order of character and talent, and reflect credit upon the party machinery that nominated them for their positions;

docs.abstract: U States Senate reject resolution favouring Protectorate
docs.lead_paragraph: A brief dispatch from Augusta, Ga., which will be found elsewhere, contains a partial confirmation of the tumor which prevailed in Washington on Tuesday, and mentioned in the TIMES of yesterday morning, to the effect that a collision had actually taken place between an American and a British war-vessel.

docs.snippet: Letters received here a day or two since from a gentleman of this City, at present traveling in Italy, bring the melancholy announcement of the death of E. S. BARTHOLOMEW, one of the most promising of our American Sculptors. Few better illustrations...

headline.main: YALE COLLEGE.; Death of E. S. Bartholomew--Art Exhibition--Union Regatta--Poem by Willis.

docs.lead_paragraph: Letters received here a day or two since from a gentleman of this City, at present traveling in Italy, bring the melancholy announcement of the death of E. S. BARTHOLOMEW, one of the most promising of our American Sculptors. Few better illustrations are afforded of the indomitable energy of genius when combined with the earnestness of the American character, than that we have in Mr. B.'s history.

docs.snippet: A POLICEMAN IN DIFFICULTY -A few mornings ago a policeman was discovered in the act of stealing several articles from a store in Atlantic-street. When charged with the offence he returned the stolen property, and immediately handed his resignation to...
docs.lead_paragraph: A POLICEMAN IN DIFFICULTY -A few mornings ago a policeman was discovered in the act of stealing several articles from a store in Atlantic-street. When charged with the offence he returned the stolen property, and immediately handed his resignation to the Deputy superintendent. Whether the Boardof Commissioners will accept it, and the proprietor of the store will consider this a sufficient punishment for the offence. remains to be seen.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Board of Councilmen met on Monday afternoon, the President, CHAS. H. HASWELL, Esq., in the Chair. Several petitions were referred. They had reference to the filing of sunken lots on Twelfth avenue; to the building of sewers in Fourth-street, and for ?? among one hundred and Tenth-street.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Swill-Milk Committee of the Board of Health met yesterday afternoon at 4 o'clock, in Room No. 8, City Hall, and proceeded to take testimony concerning the swill-milk establishments, Aldermen TUOMEY' TUCKER and READ, and Councilman HaSWELL were Present. H. L. CLINTON Esq. appeared as Counsel,
